author: smuzaffar
body:
The merge loop in L1TrackJetClustering.h was performing manual element shifting and erasing in a way that caused use-after-free and out-of-bounds accesses.

This triggers crashes or undefined behavior, especially with modern compilers (GCC 15+).

This PR proposs the following changes
- Corrects the erase logic to remove the merged cluster safely.
- Only increments the loop index when not erasing, preventing skipped elements.
- Uses trackidx.insert() to merge tracks safely

See https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/50162, it fixes few of the failing workflows in gcc15 IBs
